body_html:
nsync.a exists. Everything was compiled with the NDK, not with a different compiler (unless one of the build scripts does that internal).

As I said, I only run the build normally with setting the NDK_ROOT. That's it.

NDK_ROOT="$HOME/Library/Android/sdk/ndk-bundle" bash $MAKEFILE_DIR/build_all_android.sh
body_text:
nsync.a exists. Everything was compiled with the NDK, not with a different compiler (unless one of the build scripts does that internal).
As I said, I only run the build normally with setting the NDK_ROOT. That's it.
NDK_ROOT="$HOME/Library/Android/sdk/ndk-bundle" bash $MAKEFILE_DIR/build_all_android.sh
body:
`nsync.a` exists. Everything was compiled with the NDK, not with a different compiler (unless one of the build scripts does that internal).

As I said, I only run the build normally with setting the `NDK_ROOT`. That's it.

    NDK_ROOT="$HOME/Library/Android/sdk/ndk-bundle" bash $MAKEFILE_DIR/build_all_android.sh
